author: {'steamid': '76561197974836738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1641784007}
review: Fun little game that only takes an hour or two to complete.  Nice upgrade system that lets you create overpowered characters, although there's not really any reason to upgrade anyone other than two characters who stick with you through most of the story.  There's also some neat extra content like randomized battles which reward you with money to buy spells for your characters, but there's also not much of a need for that since the campaign is so short and you don't need any spells other than what you start with.  Fun stuff though.. I enjoyed this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969387661', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1640013636}
review: Nice pixel art, but that's literally the only positive thing I have to say about this game. The combat is extremely simple, the story is as linear as it gets, and the RPG elements are bare-bones. Even the story, which sounds great in premise (time travel! demons! immortals! magic! Merlin and Excalibur and Death himself!) is extremely simplistic. Oh, and it's super short. You can finish everything there is to do in the game in an hour or two, and that's with wasting time messing around a bit. Even so, I still had time to run into a couple of bugs to complete the experience. If you're looking for something to scratch that turn-based tactics RPG itch, this ain't it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976311109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1623552409}
review:
Decent game. I really wished I could have had bigger fights. I would have a team of 4 and then 2 of the characters would become NPCs through dialog and then it is a 2v6 fight. A few times you control more. 

The game is extremely quick. I probably beat it in 2.5 hrs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969423857', 'num_games_owned': 1886, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1618153993}
review: Short and sweet. Pretty fun afternoon tactical romp through time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009861348', 'num_games_owned': 4630, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1610087197}
review:
There's potential here, but I can't get into it... The screen jerking is the biggest part, the way it just snaps from one grid location to the next just really bothered me.

If you like old school turn based tactical combat similar to xcom with a medieval theme, this might be your kinda game but bare in mind it's rough around the edges.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971544967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1607186147}
review:
This is basically a very straightforward tactics game.  The game is a series of battles connected by a pretty good, if short story.  The battles themselves are very straightforward with the only options being attacking in melee, casting offensive spells (all but one are just single target damage spells the are almost identical) or cast a heal spell.  That's it.  Your characters have stats that you can upgrade after winning campaign battles.  You can also earn gold from random battles where you use monsters from the campaign.

This is a weird game where you need to repeat campaign battles to earn enough upgrade points to win the later battles.  The same goes for the random monster battles so you earn enough gold to unlock the important spells for your important characters.  Through the campaign you unlock maybe 8 characters or so, but weirdly you mainly just use two of them in the campaign.  The rest just show up in 1 or 2 battles.  The game doesn't tell you this though so you end up boosting characters you never end up using.  Very strange.

I can't recommend this game.  The battles are very simple with the only real thought being how to avoid exposing your back and attacking the enemies in the back.  Since that is the main part of the game I can't see how anyone is recommending this.  The story is decent but is not enough for a purchase.  The game just feels like a prototype for a better game coming later, unfortunately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052510862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1599382365}
review:
Molto Old Style tipo i giochi della SSI (Mi pare si chiamasse cos√¨ la software house che faceva i giochi tattici a turni D&D all'epoca delle schede EGA). Il gioco √® molto basico e le sfide man mano diventano divertenti. Non √® chiaro il sistema di progressione. Il gioco non ti spiega niente e ti butta subito nella mischia... sempre in rimembranza dei bei vecchi tempi quando non ci stava memoria a sufficienza per intro elaborate e spiegazioni ;)
Consigliato? Beh... come sempre la scelta √® riduttiva. Carino ma non per tutti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044277743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1593847513}
review: 100 minute JRPG where you grind early levels to upgrade your characters (and there's only two worth upgrading). most of the combat is just taking turns walking behind each other and attacking from the back. the final boss level is actually designed to let you keep attacking from behind while the boss can only hit you from the side over and over. try to beat it in under two hours i guess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016989249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1592843571}
review: The game is a disappointment. No balance, no challenge, nothing to get hold of. In fact, the only thing that can be found, is quite a decent plot. Everything else feels like a first sketch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059029645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1584327309}
review:
Resulta un soplo de aire fresco estando siempre rodeados de battle royale de todo tipo, y juegos casi fotocopiados. El juego isom√©trico permite combates de movimiento por casillas c√≥mo los cl√°sicos del estilo de Realms os arkania. (Era una autentica joya en su momento y a√∫n merece la pena jugarlo, de mis favoritos).  El uso de hechizos y la mec√°nica de juego en Weaves of fate, son simples, animando a probar las diferentes opciones, sin por ello perder encanto. Permite ajustar el nivel de dificultad, abriendo as√≠ nuevas posibilidades una vez desentra√±ada la historia, cosa que se agradece.

-Quieres una breve novela, pasa la historia en f√°cil y disfruta de la trama fant√°stica. 
-Quieres un juego de estrategia cl√°sico disfruta de las distintas opciones de combate en los tres niveles de dificultad disponibles.

Elijas lo que elijas merece la pena con su bajo precio, solo falta que los desarrolladores se animen a crear mas entregas y con nuevas tramas

author: {'steamid': '76561198357191815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1511, 'last_played': 1572824687}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988534641', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1596904750}
review:
I can't help but feel like this is a tech demo, but it's a fun one at that.

It's short, and it does require some amount of grinding especially if you want to "3 Star" all the levels.  I love the pixel art and the main character... Death, is actually pretty cool for the Grim Reaper anti-hero in all this.

There is an "Encounter" Mode which allows you to do a battle with random units vs. random units.  It's not exactly balanced BUT it can become a good source of gold for your actual characters.

My only complaints really reside on how short it is along with the wanting the Encounter Mode to be more of using the characters for leveling rather than this randomized unit.  I guess it just doesn't feel 100 fleshed out in what it could be but still entertaining.

At 4 bucks, it'll provide more entertainment than a cheeseburger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039517334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1573766730}
review:
Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ

(Good but very short little game)

============

Review:

Weaves of Fate is a simple and very short turn-based RPG.

I really like its art-style - the pixel graphics look very nice, and it has pretty good music and sounds, too.

It basically tells a short tale about a demon invasion - you start with Thanatos (the reaper) and you get more party members as you play.

The mechanics are very simple, you just move once a turn and if you're next to an enemy you can attack once.

There are spells that certain characters can do - but its basically just a few elemental spells and a heal.

============

Besides being very short - it is also very easy. Probably one of the easiest games I have ever played.

Because even if you fail a mission - you can just go back to an earlier mission, win it and upgrade the characters again.

Not that you need to grind or anything - but this system just makes it easy for anyone, and the characters strength spikes quite a lot after each mission.

============

It's a nice little side game when you don't have time or inspiration to play any of the bigger games.

I bought it on sale for around 1 euro - is it worth it? Maybe - but its not worth the full price. If it was longer, had more content and levels then it might be - but like this, I'd say its worth that 1 euro I paid for it.

So if you want a very short and easy turn-based RPG - grab it from a sale.

============

Summary:

The Good üëç
+ Very nice art style
+ Simple (in a good way)
+ Good "side-game"

The Bad üëé
- Too short
- Too easy
- Lacks replayability

author: {'steamid': '76561197964641301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1572312232}
review:
Turn-based RPG games, how can you not love these? Well, while there's a considerable number of titles available in the market, this one called my attention for two basic reasons: The graphics looked interesting and it also had a really affordable price. Now, what can I tell about my experience related to it?

So, the game offers this story that in the future, some scientists have found this ancient crystal, and while they were studying it as a new source of energy, yep, something bad happened (as you could easily guess), and now the demons came to this realm, spreading throughout time and etc. That said, the immortals decide to take action, and send Thanatos (a.k.a. Grim Reaper) against the fiends.

Being a turn-based sort of game, you can control your character(s) through the map, attack enemies and use spells against them. After you win a battle, you get experience points, which you can use to develop your party. Now, if you want to buy yourself some spells, you need to play the random battles, which comes in three different levels of difficulty; depending on the path you take, you can get more gold in the end.

As mentioned previously, the graphics look really nice, with some animations and everything. The music and sound effects aren't bad either; the gameplay is simple, and the levels are divided into different chapters. Now, I really don't want to spoil anything, but I feel that I really have to say it: That game had much more potential than what it was presented, especially when it comes to character development. The whole experience is way too short and it makes you feel like you're actually missing something when it's over.

Overall, if you're looking for an easy-going TBS run, where you can unlock all the achievements without the risk of gritting your teeth, give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198818074816', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1583537396}
review: Buen juego, lo recomiendo. Engancha mucho y es una pena que sea tan corto, desconozco la raz√≥n de no hacerlo mas amplio.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981638563', 'num_games_owned': 4007, 'num_reviews': 518, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1570799081}
review:
I think I'm in love. The thing is ‚Äì I [i]totally[/i] didn't expect anything good here. But guess what? I ended up loving this game. That's right, not just liking, [i]loving[/i] it. Maybe it's just because I'm old. I mean, the visuals remind me a lot of [b]Ultima VIII[/b] and [b]Halls of the Dead[/b], gameplay feels a lot like a very basic version of [b]HeroQuest[/b], etc. But the thing is - [b]Weaves of Fate[/b] doesn't feel like one of those games that try to make money from nostalgia. It doesn't have that cheap ‚Äú[i]Hey, look! It's almost like real 8-bit![/i]‚Äù aftertaste. It is what it is. A cute little RPG.

The ‚Äúlittle‚Äù part is a bit of a problem, though. Quite big, to be honest. See, [b]Weaves of Fate[/b] is another one of those ‚Äúone man projects‚Äù ([b]BC Kings[/b], [b]USC: Ultimate Space Commando[/b], etc). Aside from soundtrack, it was fully made by only one person. And, unfortunately, it shows. Don't get me wrong, though, the main gameplay feels great. Too great, actually. Those basic but charming turn-based battles are the exact reason why I love this game so much. Those are so cute that you'll want to waste a lot of time doing them. Unfortunately, [b]Mr. Kingston[/b] (that's the name of our guy, [b]Thomas Kingston[/b]) didn't have enough time and resources to make anything else. As the result, the entire game is just that - a short (very, [i]very[/i] short) series of battles. There's nothing else. No world to explore, no dungeons to rob, no loot to collect, no quests to do, nothing. Zero. Zilch.

So, how do you at least level up in this game? Well, first of all, you go back to the level selection screen (you're free to re-play any previous mission any time you want). Then you select ‚Äúrandom encounter‚Äù option. You finish one of those - you get some experience to increase your stats (no level cap here, as far as I know, so, you can become laughably overpowered as long as you're ready to invest enough time) and gold to unlock spells. That's pretty much it. There's nothing else in this game. You can beat the entire thing with every single achievement in about an hour and the story is also pretty basic. It has some twists and the atmosphere is sure there, but... it's basic. Very basic.

So, if you're expecting a proper RPG experience here... just keep looking. This game is a hour long series of basic old school battles and that's it. But the thing is ‚Äì those cute little battles are so charming that it's almost impossible not to love this game. And since [b]Mr. Kingston[/b] asks only [b]$ 3.99[/b] / [b]¬£ 2.89[/b] for it... I'd say, it's totally worth it. You weren't born yesterday, you have an hour of free time and some change from your last meal? Check this game out. It's one of those cute little gems that, despite being way too basic, make you feel better. Like a cup of hot chocolate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026428394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1672020822}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043861603', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1569295196}
review:
Decent for what it's worth. Easy to grind yourself to unbalanced levels though. There are two missions that are impossible to 3-star in my playthrough:

The tavern (Because it takes the post-fight scene for the stats so you'll end up with turn 1, 0 damage dished, 0 damage taken)
The mountain (Demons were too spread apart to kill within 3 moves. Perhaps if I could lower my speed it would have worked out.

I liked it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991115284', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1564892615}
review:
you can zip through the storyline in rather little time and there's really no balance to it at all. the only characters that matter to level are cain and maybe medea, given they're the only characters who are particularly consistent in your team - by "level" i mean configure to execute one-hit kills on most targets. most unlockable spells are superfluous and a waste of your time to go out of the way for, given how short and easy the game is. can definitely think of better ways to use five dollars and two hours of playtime.

storyline is sort of original, but the characterization is pretty loose and full of a lot of the same foibles that seem to plague indie designers who aren't sure how seriously they want people to take the plot (e.g. lots of derivative jokes that just don't seem to fit the mood of what's going on).

it's not awful, but it lacks depth and polish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017615137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1535591976}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987089584', 'num_games_owned': 3303, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1558644941}
review:
It's a decent little tactical RPG - [b]for its price[/b]. Were it any more expensive than it is, I wouldn't be able to recommend it, because of how short the game is. It barely took me one and a half hours to play through the game and gain all achievements, so keep the short length in mind if you consider purchasing this.

That said, it's a good game following the gameplay style of Japanese SRPG titles such as Tactics Ogre or Final Fantasy Tactics. You control a small group of pre-generated characters and fight out turn-based battles in tightly designed, hand-made encounters. The story is completely linear, there are no branching paths or even dialogue choices. The meat of the game is fighting through the battles and witnessing the story unfold after you beat each encounter.

As for the development of your characters, you get some leeway there. You can invest points into any stat of any character, increasing the health and attack of your sorceress instead of investing into her magic skills, if you want to go for unorthodox character builds. Every character has a handful of unlockable special abilities that add more tactical variety to the battles (heals, damage spells, etc).

You can also play through a bunch of random encounters if you want to squeeze more playtime out of the game than the main campaign offers. These random fights set you up with a random assortment of troops, facing off against a random assortment of enemy troops, rather than letting you play with your leveled up characters. They add some variety, but become repetitive quick.

There's also a New Game + mode where you re-play the main campaign at a higher level.

Other than that, there isn't much more to the game. A decent little turn based SRPG romp that takes you about 2 hours at the max. Since the game costs about 3 bucks, and even less when there's a sale, it's decent value for the money. But don't expect anything more from it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258089524', 'num_games_owned': 524, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1561576253}

author: {'steamid': '76561198093270531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1547533782}
review: Short but cheap and decently fun; a basic combat system of attack or magic, grid based movement and a stat upgrade system. Nothing amazing but I enjoyed it for what it was and the story was interesting. I'd say grab it on sale, easy to beat in less than 3 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031761321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1546766797}
review:
While the story and characters so far are interesting the gameplay feels clunky and unbalanced.
The camera is set up to center the characters on screen after each step, hence stuttering a lot.
It does not support gamepad and therefore breaks the pace you'll expect from these type of games.
The chapter system is a cool feature but with bad implementation. Being able to repeat them and earn better score is good, but in the end you will hate to replay them to get more XP. Also if you invest in a character that turns out to be irrelevant you will be screwed and may struggle (or worst, not be able) to finish the story

I think it's a good game that needs a little more of polishment, feels like EA atm.
The music is enthralling, graphics are warm and the overall aesthetic [i]delivers[/i], but again, some small nuances turns the game experience slow and boring.

Only for die hard fans of the genre and on sale/bundled

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198026419608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1578829758}
review:
Weaves of Fate, un jeu que j'ai d√©couvert par hasard en utilisant la fonction "Explorer" de Steam.

Eh bien √ßa sera une √©valuation positive, pourquoi?

- J'ai bien aim√© l'histoire et l'ambiance g√©n√©rale, ainsi que le style combat au tour par tour.
- Le character design des personnages est bien pens√© (alli√©s ou ennemis, la patte graphique r√©tro est sympa)
- On appr√©cie suivre l'histoire avec les diff√©rents personnages principaux (qui sont loin de manquer de charisme!)
- La bande son est vraiment sympa (J'ai d√©couvert Yui Hisaishi/Ora Chaya que je ne connaissais pas, et ses compositions au piano sont de toute beaut√©! Le Main th√®me est bien pens√©, j'adh√®re totalement!).
- Les possibilit√©s lors des combats sont assez limit√©es, mais on se prend tout de m√™me au jeu (combat au corps √† corps, magie...)
- Compter environ 3-4h pour terminer la trame principale, ensuite on peut jouer en difficult√© maximale

- Evidemment il y a pas mal d'imperfections techniques, et alors? On voit que le developpeur a vraiment essayer de transmettre ses id√©es et sa passion pour son jeu (√ßa se ressent dans le titre).

Personnellement je pr√©f√®re les jeux bourr√©s de d√©fauts poss√©dant une identit√© propre, que des AAA hyper soign√©s mais finalement sans √¢me.

Les tissages du destin m'auront port√© √† recommander ce jeu, puisse t-il y avoir une suite du m√™me auteur.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318408963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1590149045}
review:
¬øQu√© nos vamos a encontrar? Un juego cortito, de unas 3-4h pero mega rejugable. Rol por turnos de vista isom√©trica junto con estrategia t√°ctica. 

Con un pixel art precioso, de los m√°s bonitos que he visto de este estilo; colorido, definido y muy cuidado. Cada escenario se nos presenta como un peque√±o lienzo en el que jugar.
Es un juego que no se hace repetitivo para nada, los escenarios cambian as√≠ como los enemigos y a m√°s nivel m√°s estrat√©gico se volver√° y m√°s entretenido. 

La Banda sonora acompa√±a durante todo el juego, cambiando en cada escena y en cada batalla. La historia nos la pasaremos en suspiro, pero intentar completarla con todas las estrellitas nos llevar√° horas. 
Y los encuentros, poder cambiar de bando, elegir un equipo mezclado de buenos y malos, solo de demonios, o en solitario y probar cuanto duramos, es lo m√°s divertido de este juego.

Su precio no es muy elevado, y adem√°s lo ponen muy a menudo de oferta, aparte de que como digo estar√° amortizado por horas de juego, a no ser que hagamos la historia y ya. Pero el juego te invita a m√°s.

Para saber m√°s, aqui mi rese√±a para Orgullogamer [url=http://www.orgullogamers.com/2018/09/analisis-weaves-of-fate.html] An√°lisis de Weaves of Fate [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198214989148', 'num_games_owned': 2346, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1531255934}
review:
This is a positive review, that I wish I could rate as neutral.  Since this game is really good, and for the pricepoint its not half bad.   For once the creators knew how to balance price point and gameplay!   This is an SRPG where in the future humans unearth a crystal that accidentally releases demons onto the planet, which are also sent back in time.   The story jumps around a lot, but your goal is to prevent more demons from coming through.  And since you can replay stages you essentially have an infinite number of experience points.  Which is helpful since at the base stats you have the later stages of the game are impossible.   


The reason for the neutral would be that a couple of stages (I think 3-2,3-3, and 3-4) actually cannot be perfected since the counters don't work properly OR that the requirements for the stage are impossible to accomplish.   In the one after the tavern with the slave camp the suggested number of moves to beat is 3.   This is impossible since even with max movement (move area is capped at 20 speed I think) you are 1 space away from being able to attack the enemies with Cain.   There are 3 enemies and they are spread out too far for Medea to hit 2 of them with one rain of fire, so the minimum amount of moves is 4.  One to move Medea and kill one demon, the next to move Cain closer, a third with Medea to kill another demon, and the fourth to have Cain kill the last one.   Again quite frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004514245', 'num_games_owned': 868, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1528395870}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197993368913', 'num_games_owned': 2098, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1522623188}
review: Weaves of Fate is a fun little game that doesn't overstay its welcome. The visuals are really nice and the story is quite charming in its simplicity. The combat is fun enough though it won't win any prices for its complexity. It is a short game however and it can be completed in a couple of hours. There are random encounters though if you are into that. Still i think that i got my moneys worth out of the game and i would recommend it if you are interested in the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987707305', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1520117138}

Very short but enjoyable game. It kind of plays like a simplified Final Fantasy Tactics.  

I recommend playing it inbetween larger games, perhaps in one or two sittings where you can just zone out and enjoy the story. 

Very easy to get 100% achievements. 

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198798936849', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1579911547}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055006994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1517338734}
review:
This one is a hard sell, It has good enough graphics, good music and a nice story (I LOVE those characters and references), I totally enjoyed my time with this game but I can ONLY recommend it during a sale (or in a bundle) AND IF you are willing to look past its mistakes:

-Shallow combat, eventually battles devolve into a turn based attack competition without any strategy (No buffs, almost no crowd control, most spells are elemental damage spells and there isnt even a deep elemental weakness system to back those up)
-Broken progression system, you can become totally OP extremely easy BUT since characters are limited to certain stages you can also waste all your skill points on worthless characters and become unable to finish the story (maybe some grinding of optional missions can help you, but I doubt it)
-Broken economy, you can only gain gold in optional missions and those are RNG (the units you can control, the enemy units and all of their positions is random) so there is no reason to go for the "easy" or "medium" ones since the "hard" ones give you enough gold to buy every skill in the game early
-BAD UI (selecting "move" to move instead of clicking WHERE to move is bad)
-Needs more hotkeys (almost everything is controlled with the mouse or the arrows)
-Mediocre (but working) camera controls (2D game, no rotation either)
-Extremely short (almost 2 hours with grinding included, but it DOES have a NG+ option and some optional scenarios that can extend its playtime to I guess 4 hours at most)

IF you decide to buy it be sure to upgrade Cain, you could probably pass the whole game multiple times with no grinding if you focus all your skill points in him, and maybe upgrade Medea a little since she has the only Crowd Control Spell worth using.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026601053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1514579037}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078141868', 'num_games_owned': 1987, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1513516067}
review: Combates con vista isom√©trica y unos gr√°ficos molones. Es cortito, pero merece la pena. Ojal√° el desarrollador alargara un poco m√°s la historia :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198002591921', 'num_games_owned': 4931, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1512937649}
review:
Very short (took 2 hours to beat without much difficulty), but thoroughly competent, Weaves of Fate is a tentative recommendation from me.

The graphics and story are excellent. The game play mechanics are strong if not stunning. Upgrades scale satisfyingly and add some small depth to the game.

The bones of a great game are here, but as one plays it, he notices the developer's illusions and shortcuts.

There are many interesting playable characters, but you soon realize that, despite their customization potential, they are ancillary. Only two characters are ultimately worth upgrading. And the final stage completely comes down to how high you've grinded a particular character. Flaws  like these  keep the game from excellence but if the developer fleshes out these ideas Weaves of Fate would be tremendous.

I recommend this on sale. It's worth the time it takes to beat it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047097123', 'num_games_owned': 2562, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1512455235}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065073825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1559049563}
review:
Es un Rpg, y por lo tanto, tienes que leer bastante.

Los fallos de expresi√≥n son horribles, la persona que ha traducido el juego al castellano desconoce la forma de expresarlo correctamente por escrito. Las frases, o bien no tienen comas, o bien las tienen en lugares donde NO la necesitan. 

A veces se usa la misma palabra una y otra vez en la frase, ejemplo: "Con las fuerzas demoniacas corriendo desenfrenadas a trav√©s del tiempo alterando el pasado,  los tejidos del destino y el destino comenzaron a desmoronarse‚Äù.

La frase es vomitiva, la forma ‚Äúcorrecta‚Äù es: ‚Äúlas fuerzas demoniacas corren desenfrenadas, surcan el tiempo alterando el pasado. El tejido del destino ha comenzado a desmoronarse‚Äù. √âsto es un simple ejemplo, hay cientos de frases mal escritas, a las cuales les han intentado dar un toque "po√©tico", pero que en el fondo dan c√°ncer.

Aunque por otra parte, √©sto es algo subjetivo, posiblemente la cancer√≠gena prosa de √©ste juego no sea de tu total desagrado, y solo busques pasar una experiencia entretenida; por lo tanto, analicemos el juego.

Me gusta la m√∫sica, los colores, el pixel art y el manejo estrat√©gico del t√≠tulo. Es corto, entretenido y me ha salido gratis, por lo tanto, no puedo quejarme. Me gusta la idea de potenciar mis soldados. No es gran cosa, nuevo euros no vale NI DE CO√ëA, pero no est√° mal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003818180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1599, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1509569247}
review:
Waves of Fate es un juego con vista isom√©trica y un pixel art bastante elaborado, tiene una campa√±a con una historia interesante de duraci√≥n corta,(no llega a 3 horas), puedes actualizar tus unidades, obtener nuevas unidades.

La muerte de las unidad no es permanente y una vez acabas la campa√±a tiene nuevo juego+, para pasartelo con enemigos de m√°s dificultad pero conservando las mejoras que hayas hecho durante la campa√±a.

Bajo mi punto de vista es muy buen juego por el precio que tiene.

Los desarrolladores est√°n activos en el foro e implementan sugerencias de manera muy r√°pida.

Si te gustan los juegos de estrategia por turnos de la vieja escuela como Tactics Ogre o Final Fantasy Tactics, definitivamente te gustar√° este juego.

Espero que su desarrollador tenga √©xito en sus futuros proyectos, un saludo a todos y gracias por leerme.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974684590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1512650721}
review:
From how far I played till yet, the storyline looks very interesting. 
Since I awaited something like the old heroquest, I am a little bit disappointed about the lag of play depth. Nothing to loot? Maybe I didn't play so far, simply. But instead there is the upgrade-option, which I like. 

You can happily forget about the german translation (google translated?). Its a bit confusing, that the font changes with the language. But I don't care much. Its such an basic english, its totally understandable.
The stats could be a bit more obvious. You cant really compare, which enemy has how much power. You see how much HP and MP they have, but you have no idea if hitting them make them laugh or if one hit of them can crack your bones to dust. 

But what I am missing the most is a support for higher or at least wider resolutions / aspect correction. Would be nice to see the whole map if you have "enough" res.

Beside that I enjoyed the few minutes playing so far and am looking forward to continue.

Edit: sorry, but at all love I have for this little game, the system is too messed up for a thumb up. The Turn-counter does what it wants, but counting... the moves? ...the turns? ...the actions? ...the enemies actions? So it seems impossible to reach 3 stars. Why should one make such an efford anyway? 
Alltogether its so many little bugs, its frustrating. The game is playable and nice and everything, but you can forget about serious refinement. 
I am really sorry, but I have to change the thumb downwards if I look to the price of the game. :(

Edit 2: The Dev is solicitous, what I really appreciate!
So there was an update. As soon as I find the time, I will give it happily another try. :) ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198134011495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1508619706}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970533201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1508109315}
review: It's just all turn based combat tied together with brief cutscenes? I was hoping for a few classic RPG elements like exploration and dialouge choices and resouce management... I mean at least a little bit? No offense to the creator's hard work but this seems like something I programmed myself back in the late 1980's in Computer Workshop. This isn't a game - it's more of the same very simple tile based combat over and over and over and over... it's a good first step towards a game - but it's only the combat routine. It needs world building - exploration - interactive dialouge - resources... Another thing - is there a difficulty setting? I just keep dying on the Medea battle and can't get past it. It's only like 5 minutes into the game and it's a battle I can't win... why? I think I've tried to fight that battle a dozen times and my guys just get slaughtered every time. Am I missing something here?
developer_response:
Hi,

I'm sorry you're having issues with the difficulty! Don't forget that when you beat levels, you earn EXP that you can use to upgrade your characters in the main menu to make them stronger and more resistant to damage. This might be what you are missing! If it still ends up being too difficult for you though, do come back and post again as I can look at implementing a different way for users to tweak difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018756376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1501967172}
review:
I'm conflicted about this review. It's a nifty indy game with an interesting story line. As it stands now though the game is closer to an EA state than something I'd expect in a release.

Missing Features/Bugs:
Mouse support - Control is keyboard only (arrow key style), no mouse even in menus.
Mutiple resolution support - Windowed mode at a small resolution only. Cannot modify resolution or play full screen.
Display bug - When playing sometimes assets, like an enemy will not be displayed. Once this happens additional assets seem to go black. Currently I'm fighting a battle with only my party on a black screen.

It's also a bit pointelessly grindy, you can replay any mission you want as many times as you want to earn points. Those points can be used to increase the stats of any character. You end up grinding the same levels over and over to pump stats to keep getting 3-stars on missions. Go overboard and gameplay is pretty much broken.

I'd hope the developer addresses at least the glaring bugs. The story line is nifty enough to make me ignore the grindy bits.
developer_response:
Thank you for your feedback and the review! I just wanted to post a reply and let you know that I recently pushed an update to the game which includes mouse support. The game also now starts in fullscreen and can be toggled between windowed and fullscreen.

For your issue about the display bug, I am currently working on fixing that and hope to have another update for that soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048010899', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1501946262}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980333161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1502851260}
review:
Waves of Fate is a nice game, the isometric view and pixel art is beautiful, you have a lot of story campaigns to play through, you can upgrade your units, get new units, there is no hardcore mode. Unit death is not permanent. Difficulty is moderate. You can make your life easier through grinding.

A nice game, very good game for the price.

The developers are active in the forum and implementing suggestions super fast.

If you like old school turnbased strategy games like Final fantasy tactics, or tactics ogre, you will definetely like this game

Thank you for reading, have a nice day.
